content: May 8 (Reuters) - The Dow and S&amp;P 500 indexes opened higher on Monday, with shares of PacWest leading a rally among regional banks ahead of a key inflation reading this week.

The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 40.77 points, or 0.12%, at the open to 33,715.15.The S&amp;P 500 opened higher by 0.73 points, or 0.02%, at 4,136.98, while the Nasdaq Composite dropped 3.73 points, or 0.03%, to 12,231.68 at the opening bell. (Reporting by Shristi Achar A in Bengaluru; Editing by Maju Samuel)
